clinical_study.brief_title: Stapled vs Hand Sewn Anastomosis in Roux en Y Gastric Bypass for Morbid Obesity: Randomized Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Stapled vs Hand Sewn Anastomosis in Roux en Y Gastric Bypass for Morbid Obesity: Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Ministerio de Sanidad, Servicios Sociales e Igualdad

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare postoperative complications between hand sewn and stapled anastomosis after performing Roux en Y-Gastric Bypass as a treatment for morbid obesity.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first month after surgery
primary_outcome.description: To compare postoperative complications after bariatric surgery between stapled anastomosis and hand sewn anastomosis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first month after surgery

arm_group.description: Patients with hand sewn anastomosis during Roux en Y Gastric bypass performing
Patients with stapled anastomosis during Roux en Y Gastric Bypass performing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients over 18 years
- absence of previous bariatric surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- less than 18 years old
- coagulation disorders or liver cirrhosis
